resources.string: 打开视频换天功能面板
"Shoot a subject that's moving all the way across the screen."
Your subject can ski, play basketball, dance, or simply walk.
Frozen frames will be \"picked up\" while the video is playing.
This high-contrast filter retains only yellow and dark blue colors. Use it on well-lit streets of a night city.
A color scheme commonly used in movies adds green to the darker areas. This filter works well for high-contrast scenes such as dusk in the city.
The combination of high contrast and saturation brings out the tang of passion and ardor.
This unique combination of colors works perfect in cloudy weather and soft light.
Dark tones and soft contrast are suitable for soft-lit indoor scenes.
Brownish tones and medium contrast create a warm atmosphere for outdoor scenes shot in natural light.
High contrast and low saturation will bring cinematic feel to most scenes.
A classic movie trick that makes dark areas colder and lights warmer. This filter will freshen up both the urban jungle and great outdoors.
请展开手机，用外部屏幕拍照
Place your subject into the frame and keep the device at least %d meter away
Move the device away from your subject steadily
Lost track of the subject. Start over.
You moved the device too far away. Start over.
"Make sure there's enough space between your subject and the background."
Try to avoid large areas of solid color.
Place your subject into the frame.
Ask your subject not to move.
Remember to keep the subject inside the frame while shooting.
Move the device away from your subject steadily.
Time freeze videos can only be recorded in landscape orientation
Tap the shutter to start recording
"Turn on to maintain focus on people and animals automatically. You'll also be able to select subjects for tracking manually."
Record sound via external microphone when mic-equipped Bluetooth earphones are connected
Play recorded sound into the earphones when they are connected
Reduce noise in videos depending on the scene
Reduce the impact of wind on sound recording
Filter sounds from behind the screen while recording
Track objects moving in low light.
Try slow shutter in different scenes.
This effect works well with running people and moving vehicles.
Capture movement blur in the background.
You can freeze and unfreeze the background any time before or during shooting.
Ask your subject to stay in the center of the frame.
This portrait filter shows people in color, making backgrounds black and white.
Soft colors recreate the nostalgic look of the movies shot on film.
Low saturation and contrast bring some Nordic noir into cloudy and soft-lit indoor environments.
Warm retro monochrome works for most scenes.
Low contrast and bright tones perform well when you need to preserve skin tones. This filter is suitable for sunny outdoor scenes.
